level.heading: DUE PROCESS SCOPE AND PROCEDURES FOR BLIND VENDORS AND RSVFP TRAINEES RECEIVINGOCATIONAL REHABILITATION SERVICES (ยง 29-218)

level.text: The purpose of these regulations is to establish procedures pursuant to the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, as amended, and 34 C.F.R. ยง 395.11, which provide vendors and/or RSVFP trainees the opportunity to resolve disagreements with any determination concerning the furnishing or denial of vocational rehabilitation services offered in connection with the Randolph-Sheppard Vending Facility Program (RSVFP).

218.2 (a) A Vendor or RSVFP trainee who is dissatisfied with any determination concerning the furnishing or denial of vocational rehabilitation services or training, provided under the Rehabilitation Act of 1973 and/or 34 C.F.R. ยง 395.11, has the right to pursue any or all of the following options provided in 34 C.F.R. ยง 361.57:
Informal administrative review meeting with the Chief of the Division of Services for the Blind (DSB);
Impartial due process hearing before the D.C. Office of

A service determination dispute regarding vocational rehabilitation services may be resolved at any level within the appeals process. The appeal process is initiated when a vendor or RSVFP trainee requests an informal administrative review meeting. However, a vendor or RSVFP trainee is not precluded from beginning his or her appeal by requesting mediation or requesting an impartial due process hearing, as a means to resolve a determination that affects the provision of vocational rehabilitation services.
